item.title: Notes on Diffusion Models
item.description: Notations $p(z|x)$: true posterior. $q_\phi(z|x)$: approximate posterior with parameters $\phi$. $x_0$: true data. $x_t, t \in [1,T]$: latent variables. $q(x_{t}|x_{t-1})$: forward process. $p(x_t|x_{t+1})$: reverse process. Understanding Diffusion Models from the Perspective of VAE This section briefly summarizes @Luo2022 with my understanding, particularly focusing on the math logic of behind the diffusion models. The original article by Calvin Luo is highly recommended! It helps a lot! Evidence Lower Bound What are likelihood-based generative models?
